item.title: Bhavishya Ecommerce Boosts Stake in Deep Diamond India to 5.82%
item.description: Top News Bhavishya Ecommerce Boosts Stake in Deep Diamond India to 5.82% 7 minutes ago Bhavishya Ecommerce Private Limited has increased its ownership in Deep Diamond India Limited through open market purchases. The company acquired 1,868,363 shares, representing a 1.30% stake, on December 8, 2025. This acquisition has raised Bhavishya Ecommerce's total shareholding in Deep Diamond India from 4.52% (6,519,935 shares) to 5.82% (8,388,298 shares).

item.title: Markets at Noon: Nifty and Sensex Slip Marginally on December 10
item.description: Markets at Noon: Nifty and Sensex Slip Marginally on December 10 2 hours ago Indian stock markets show a slight downward trend at midday with Nifty 50 at 25,832.00 (-0.03%) and Sensex at 84,628.37 (-0.04%). Key stocks buzzing include InterGlobe Aviation facing DGCA notice, Biocon acquiring stake in Biocon Biologics, Infosys expanding to Vietnam, ICICI Bank increasing stake in ICICI AMC, and Pine Labs reporting strong quarterly results. The market sentiment remains cautious with investors closely watching developments across various sectors.

item.title: Meesho's Strong Market Debut: Shares List at 45% Premium on BSE
item.description: Meesho's Strong Market Debut: Shares List at 45% Premium on BSE 4 hours ago Meesho made a strong debut on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), with its shares listing at ₹161.20, a 45% premium over the issue price of ₹111.00. The listing price represents a gain of ₹50.20 per share for IPO investors. This robust performance indicates positive investor sentiment towards Meesho's business model and the growing e-commerce sector in India.

item.title: Callista Industries Revises Preferential Issue Plan, Adjusts Warrant and Equity Share Allocation
item.description: Callista Industries Revises Preferential Issue Plan, Adjusts Warrant and Equity Share Allocation 2 minutes ago Callista Industries Limited has announced changes to its preferential allotment plan. The revised plan reduces convertible warrants from 3,37,50,000 to 2,93,50,000 and increases equity shares for non-promoters from 12,50,000 to 56,50,000. The allocation includes 81,00,000 warrants to promoter Rashmi Ravi Sharma and 55,00,000 to Koriander Consultants LLP. Non-promoter equity share allocations include 10,00,000 to Koriander Consultants LLP. The company will issue a corrigendum to the AGM notice and seek shareholder approval for these changes. The revision comes amid concerning financial indicators, including negative shareholders' capital and increasing non-current liabilities.
